segment.source: This topic presents a case study of porting a functioning peer-to-peer quiz game WinRT 8.1 sample app to a Windows 10 Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: This topic presents a case study of porting a functioning peer-to-peer quiz game WinRT 8.1 sample app to a Windows 10 Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: A Universal 8.1 app is one that builds two versions of the same app: one app package for Windows 8.1, and a different app package for Windows Phone 8.1.
segment.target: A Universal 8.1 app is one that builds two versions of the same app: one app package for Windows 8.1, and a different app package for Windows Phone 8.1.

segment.source: The WinRT 8.1 version of QuizGame uses a Universal Windows app project arrangement, but it takes a different approach and it builds a functionally distinct app for the two platforms.
segment.target: The WinRT 8.1 version of QuizGame uses a Universal Windows app project arrangement, but it takes a different approach and it builds a functionally distinct app for the two platforms.

segment.source: The Windows 8.1 app package serves as the host for a quiz game session, while the Windows Phone 8.1 app package plays the role of the client to the host.
segment.target: The Windows 8.1 app package serves as the host for a quiz game session, while the Windows Phone 8.1 app package plays the role of the client to the host.

segment.source: The two halves of the quiz game session communicate via peer-to-peer networking.
segment.target: The two halves of the quiz game session communicate via peer-to-peer networking.

segment.source: Tailoring the two halves to PC, and phone, respectively makes good sense.
segment.target: Tailoring the two halves to PC, and phone, respectively makes good sense.

segment.source: But, wouldn't it be even better if you could run both the host and the client on just about any device of your choosing?
segment.target: But, wouldn't it be even better if you could run both the host and the client on just about any device of your choosing?

segment.source: In this case study, we'll port both apps to Windows 10 where they will each build into a single app package that users can install onto a wide range of devices.
segment.target: In this case study, we'll port both apps to Windows 10 where they will each build into a single app package that users can install onto a wide range of devices.

segment.source: The app uses patterns that make use of views and view models.
segment.target: The app uses patterns that make use of views and view models.

segment.source: As a result of this clean separation, the porting process for this app is very straightforward, as you'll see.
segment.target: As a result of this clean separation, the porting process for this app is very straightforward, as you'll see.

segment.target: Note This sample assumes your network is configured to send and receive custom UDP group multicast packets (most home networks are, although your work network may not be).

segment.source: The sample also sends and receives TCP packets.
segment.target: The sample also sends and receives TCP packets.

segment.source: This is a short hypothetical account of the app in use, but it provides useful info should you want to try out the app for yourself over your wireless network.
segment.target: This is a short hypothetical account of the app in use, but it provides useful info should you want to try out the app for yourself over your wireless network.

segment.source: A fun quiz game is taking place in a bar.
segment.target: A fun quiz game is taking place in a bar.

segment.source: There's a big TV in the bar that everyone can see.
segment.target: There's a big TV in the bar that everyone can see.

segment.source: The quizmaster has a PC whose output is being shown on the TV.
segment.target: The quizmaster has a PC whose output is being shown on the TV.

segment.source: That PC has "the host app" running on it.
segment.target: That PC has "the host app" running on it.

segment.source: Anyone who wants to take part in the quiz just needs to install "the client app" on their phone or Surface.
segment.target: Anyone who wants to take part in the quiz just needs to install "the client app" on their phone or Surface.

segment.source: The host app is in lobby mode, and on the big TV, it's advertising that it's ready for client apps to connect.
segment.target: The host app is in lobby mode, and on the big TV, it's advertising that it's ready for client apps to connect.

segment.source: Joan launches the client app on her mobile device.
segment.target: Joan launches the client app on her mobile device.

segment.source: She types her name into the Player name text box and taps Join game.
segment.target: She types her name into the Player name text box and taps Join game.

segment.source: The host app acknowledges that Joan has joined by displaying her name, and Joan’s client app indicates that it's waiting for the game to begin.
segment.target: The host app acknowledges that Joan has joined by displaying her name, and Joan’s client app indicates that it's waiting for the game to begin.

segment.source: Next, Maxwell goes through those same steps on his mobile device.
segment.target: Next, Maxwell goes through those same steps on his mobile device.

segment.source: The quizmaster clicks Start game and the host app shows a question and the possible answers (it also shows a list of the joined players in normal fontweight, colored gray).
segment.target: The quizmaster clicks Start game and the host app shows a question and the possible answers (it also shows a list of the joined players in normal fontweight, colored gray).

segment.source: Simultaneously, the answers appear displayed on buttons on joined client devices.
segment.target: Simultaneously, the answers appear displayed on buttons on joined client devices.

segment.source: Joan taps the button with the answer "1975" on it whereupon all her buttons become disabled.
segment.target: Joan taps the button with the answer "1975" on it whereupon all her buttons become disabled.

segment.source: On the host app, Joan’s name is painted green (and becomes bold) in acknowledgment of the receipt of her answer.
segment.target: On the host app, Joan’s name is painted green (and becomes bold) in acknowledgment of the receipt of her answer.

segment.source: Maxwell answers, also.
segment.target: Maxwell answers, also.

segment.source: The quizmaster, noting that all players' names are green, clicks Next question.
segment.target: The quizmaster, noting that all players' names are green, clicks Next question.

segment.source: Questions continue to be asked and answered in this same cycle.
segment.target: Questions continue to be asked and answered in this same cycle.

segment.source: When the last question is being shown on the host app, Show results is the content of the button, and not Next question.
segment.target: When the last question is being shown on the host app, Show results is the content of the button, and not Next question.

segment.source: When Show results is clicked, the results are shown.
segment.target: When Show results is clicked, the results are shown.

segment.source: Clicking Return to lobby returns to the beginning of the game lifecycle with the exception that joined players remain joined.
segment.target: Clicking Return to lobby returns to the beginning of the game lifecycle with the exception that joined players remain joined.

segment.source: But, going back to the lobby gives new players a chance to join, and even a convenient time for joined players to leave (although a joined player can leave at any time by tapping Leave game).
segment.target: But, going back to the lobby gives new players a chance to join, and even a convenient time for joined players to leave (although a joined player can leave at any time by tapping Leave game).

segment.source: Local test mode
segment.target: Local test mode

segment.source: To try out the app and its interactions on a single PC instead of distributed across devices, you can build the host app in local test mode.
segment.target: To try out the app and its interactions on a single PC instead of distributed across devices, you can build the host app in local test mode.

segment.source: This mode completely bypasses use of the network.
segment.target: This mode completely bypasses use of the network.

segment.source: Instead, the UI of the host app displays the host portion to the left of the window and, to the right, two copies of the client app UI stacked vertically (note that, in this version, the local test mode UI is fixed for a PC display; it does not adapt to small devices).
segment.target: Instead, the UI of the host app displays the host portion to the left of the window and, to the right, two copies of the client app UI stacked vertically (note that, in this version, the local test mode UI is fixed for a PC display; it does not adapt to small devices).

segment.source: These segments of UI, all in the same app, communicate with one another via a mock client communicator, which simulates the interactions that would otherwise take place over the network.
segment.target: These segments of UI, all in the same app, communicate with one another via a mock client communicator, which simulates the interactions that would otherwise take place over the network.

segment.source: To activate local test mode, define LOCALTESTMODEON (in project properties) as a conditional compilation symbol, and rebuild.
segment.target: To activate local test mode, define LOCALTESTMODEON (in project properties) as a conditional compilation symbol, and rebuild.

segment.target: Porting to a Windows 10 project

segment.target: QuizGame has the following pieces.

segment.target: QuizGame.Windows.

segment.target: This is the project that builds the app package for the host app, which targets Windows 8.1.

segment.target: QuizGame.WindowsPhone.

segment.target: This is the project that builds the app package for the client app, which targets Windows Phone 8.1.

segment.source: QuizGame.Shared.
segment.target: QuizGame.Shared.

segment.source: This is the project that contains source code, markup files, and other assets and resources, that are used by both of the other two projects.
segment.target: This is the project that contains source code, markup files, and other assets and resources, that are used by both of the other two projects.

segment.source: For this case study, we have the usual options described in If you have a Universal 8.1 app with respect to what devices to support.
segment.target: For this case study, we have the usual options described in If you have a Universal 8.1 app with respect to what devices to support.

segment.source: Based on those options, we'll port QuizGame.Windows to a new Windows 10 project called QuizGameHost.
segment.target: Based on those options, we'll port QuizGame.Windows to a new Windows 10 project called QuizGameHost.

segment.source: And, we'll port QuizGame.WindowsPhone to a new Windows 10 project called QuizGameClient.
segment.target: And, we'll port QuizGame.WindowsPhone to a new Windows 10 project called QuizGameClient.

segment.source: These projects will target the universal device family, so they will run on any device.
segment.target: These projects will target the universal device family, so they will run on any device.

segment.source: And, we'll keep the QuizGame.Shared source files, etc, in their own folder, and we'll link those shared files into the two new projects.
segment.target: And, we'll keep the QuizGame.Shared source files, etc, in their own folder, and we'll link those shared files into the two new projects.

segment.source: Conclusion
segment.target: Conclusion

segment.source: The app that we ported in this case study was a relatively complex one involving several projects, a class library, and quite a large amount of code and user interface.
segment.target: The app that we ported in this case study was a relatively complex one involving several projects, a class library, and quite a large amount of code and user interface.

segment.source: Even so, the port was straightforward.
segment.target: Even so, the port was straightforward.

segment.source: Some of the ease of porting is directly attributable to the similarity between the Windows 10 developer platform and the Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1 platforms.
segment.target: Some of the ease of porting is directly attributable to the similarity between the Windows 10 developer platform and the Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1 platforms.
